definition: to suffer as a consequence of one's own actions/you asked for it/to bring it on oneself (sth unpleasant)
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to bring trouble on oneself

sentences.english: If you park on those yellow lines, you are really asking for it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把車停在黃線上，你就真是自找麻煩了。

sentences.english: You're just looking for trouble if you bring it to his attention.
sentences.chinese: 你讓他注意到這件事純粹就是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: Don't trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
sentences.chinese: 麻煩沒有來找你，別去自找麻煩。

sentences.english: Can not be competent to do their own thing is hard to find their own food.
sentences.chinese: 做自己無法勝任的事情，無疑是自找苦喫。

sentences.english: I am looking for a pain I just love my man to get married.
sentences.chinese: 我在自找苦喫，殊不知我只愛娶我的男人。

sentences.english: Don't be late again, or you'll ask for it.
sentences.chinese: 別再遲到了，要不然你會自找苦喫的。

sentences.english: But how can tools help us get rid of self-imposed complexity?
sentences.chinese: 但是工具如何幫助我們去除自找的複雜性呢？

sentences.english: Do this for lap after lap at a higher intensity and you're asking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果這樣一圈圈地遊，那麼你是在自找麻煩。

sentences.english: Also not quite right, because most of RIM's troubles are of its own making.
sentences.chinese: 也不盡然，因爲RIM的大多數麻煩都是自找的。

sentences.english: If you climb moutains in fog, you're asking for trouble .
sentences.chinese: 如果你在霧中登山，那就是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: She is making a rod for her own back by spoiling her son like that.
sentences.chinese: 她把兒子寵壞了，她是在自找苦喫。

sentences.english: If you harm a hair of my daughter's head, you'll get yourself into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 你要是動我女兒一根毫毛，你可就自找麻煩了。

sentences.english: That's what gets them into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 那樣他們就算自找麻煩了。

sentences.english: Do not get involved with politics. That'sborrowing trouble.
sentences.chinese: 不要涉足政界，那簡直是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: Enterprise software is almost uniformly horrible, but there's no reason for that.
sentences.chinese: 企業軟件確實非常麻煩，但這種煩惱卻是我們自找的。

sentences.english: It may have been sending mosquitos after a fly swatter, but they had the balls to confront China.
sentences.chinese: 也許是在自找死路，但是至少他們有面對中國的本事。

definition: to reap what one has sown (idiom)/to stew in one's own juice
to have only oneself to blame (idiom)/to bring trouble through one's own actions
disaster one brings on oneself/to be reponsible for something bad that happens to oneself/to have only oneself to blame
to bring trouble on oneself
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
(coll.) serve sb right/deservedly/ought/should
cannot blame/no wonder
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
(derog.) this is all thanks to you!/well, thanks a lot!
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
meddling in other people's business
strange/curious/surprising
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
to sin
to imagine that one's love is reciprocated/to shower affection on an uninterested party
